alert.note: Alert for Logan; Sherman; Thomas; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 12:23AM CDT until June 17 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM MDT/1215 PM CDT/ SATURDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Colorado and Kansas, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, Cheyenne and Kit Carson. In Kansas, Logan, Sherman, Thomas and Wallace. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM MDT Saturday /1215 PM CDT Saturday/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1111 PM MDT /1211 AM CDT/, 1 to 3 inches of rain fell across the warned area late Friday afternoon and evening. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Burlington, Sharon Springs, Stratton, Weskan, Bethune, Winona, Vona, Wallace and Russell Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
